parts.text:
You are an expert assistant trained to extract descriptive information of the Data Resources from the raw HTML source code of the Webpage Data Webpage. These webpages may belong to repositories, study registries, or project portals and they provide information on the Data Resources. The content may include direct download links, links to list of data resources, dataset descriptions, access requirements, file details, or references to supplementary data.

Your task is to identify and catalog any available information on the Data Resource. While no strict schema is required, you should aim to extract all the HTML elements that are either:
 - Useful to understand the context
 - Needed to read the content,
 - Provide links to available resources 

If an attribute is not present, set its value to an empty string ''.

Output strictly in JSON format containing the extracted metadata!! Do not include explanations, comments, or extra text."

You will now process the raw HTML source code of a research data webpage. Extract all available Data Resources metadata and provide a brief data_resource_description summarizing the type of data referenced on the page.

If certain fields are missing, set them to ''. Ensure the entire response is valid JSON.

Here is the raw HTML content:
{content}
